Photo via Unsplash

This Week in Genesis, Rainmaker Digital confirm they will launch StudioPress Sites in the next few days (and Brian Gardner answers a load of questions about it); new theme releases, plus the launch of Dynamik 2.0.

StudioPress Sites aiming to launch on Tue 31 Jan

Following on from last week’s announcement, Brian Gardner revealed this week that the new StudioPress Sites service from Rainmaker Digital is hoping to launch on Tuesday 31 January.

Billed as an alternative to SquareSpace, there’s been a lot of speculation about exactly what StudioPress Sites will and won’t be.

And while the only way to find out for sure is to purchase it at launch (they’ll be a 30 day money back guarantee if you decide it’s not for you), Brian has been popping up on the Gensis Slack and Genesis Facebook groups to answer a lot of questions too.

You’ll need to be a member of each group, but check out the following two threads for more information:

  • https://genesiswp.slack.com/archives/general/p1485466962001711
  • https://www.facebook.com/groups/genesiswp/permalink/1386970964687430/

Sridhar Katakam has also published a great round-up – StudioPress Sites is coming – What We Know So Far – over on his website, summarising it as:

a great move by StudioPress to put together the best of their Genesis themes, lessons from Synthesis and experience with Rainmaker service into one budget-friendly GenesisWP hosting offering competing with the likes of WP Engine and Pagely.

EDIT: There’s also a great round-up by Rebecca Gill over at Web Savvy Marketing (h/t Brian Gardner).

@GenesisWPguide Might want to include this post as well from @WebSavvyMrkting — https://t.co/JD4osuEx95

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) January 29, 2017

Themes

Brian Gardner updates his Minimalist theme and re-launches it as Minimalist Pro and you can grab it now for the price of free.

Introducing the Minimalist Pro Theme (FREE!) — https://t.co/VUZbChEkf7 #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/Qyy2UooFkt

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) January 23, 2017

ZigZagPress release their 34th Genesis child theme, Slush.

Introducing Slush: our 34th #genesiswp child theme! https://t.co/vPuBcQkPGy

— zigzagpress.com (@zigzagpress) January 23, 2017

Showcase

Gorgeous new site from Works Progress for best selling author Ava Miles

New on https://t.co/vUGfVnMBds, gorgeous new site for best selling author Ava Miles from @worksprogress https://t.co/zrDnSuxKwZ

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) January 25, 2017

Nice site by Creative Visual Design for stellasrichmond.com

@stellasrichmond's location in Charleston is open & website is live. @GIAVOS @katrinaGiavos#webdesign #genesiswp @studiopress @bgardner pic.twitter.com/8CATXNT0x8

— CreativeVisualDesign (@CreativeVisual) January 25, 2017

Best of the rest

Not content with his excellent StudioPress Sites round-up, Sridhar’s has also been busy publishing a fantastic and Comprehensive Guide to Genesis Theme Supports.

The Comprehensive Guide to Genesis Theme Supports:https://t.co/cvJiUbhybc#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/s1QEeqN8WO

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) January 23, 2017

Plus his usual array of code tutorials, including the following member only ones:

  • Adjacent Entry Navigation in Genesis with Thumbnails
  • Posts grid on single posts in Genesis
  • Random widget area after second post in Genesis

Adjacent Entry Navigation in Genesis with Thumbnails:https://t.co/g0XAbJhpSP pic.twitter.com/v6cWJkPTYK

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) January 24, 2017

Posts grid on single posts in Genesis:https://t.co/goKfI3WVRRhttps://t.co/kE5FRWdafC pic.twitter.com/0czsNUTWjA

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) January 22, 2017

Random widget area after second post in Genesis:https://t.co/ZbGtMFsa6ehttps://t.co/j7x29cNQru

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) January 22, 2017

Version 2 of Dynamik, a popular Genesis theme builder by Eric Hamm, has just been released, boasting:

  • an all new front end CSS builder
  • Genesis / Dynamik hooks map
  • fixed ‘sticky’ header feature
  • all new code editior integration

Introducing Dynamik 2.0 https://t.co/nykYCR9mcF #wordpress #genesiswp

— Cobalt Apps (@cobaltapps) January 24, 2017

And finally…

Calvin Koepke – famous for his stylish Genesis child theme releases and popular Genesis starter theme – is looking for suggestions for a JavaScript project for Genesis.

If you’ve got a suggestion, let him know!

Thinking of starting a #js plugin project to hone some new skills. Specifically targeting #genesiswp, people — so, any suggestions?

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) January 28, 2017
